alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 2:46PM EDT until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Okaloosa. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 144 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Low lying areas of Destin and Fort Walton Beach will likely begin to see ponding of roadways making travel difficult across this area. This is especially true along highway 98 near Okaloosa Island bridge. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wright, Fort Walton Beach, Destin, Eglin AFB, Lake Lorraine, Ocean City, Shalimar, Cinco Bayou, Eglin Village and Longwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
